HTGS API

The Hybrid Task Graph Scheduler API
Aids developers in representing algorithms as hybrid pipeline workflows using hybrid task graphs

Download

View on GitHub Documentation

What is HTGS?

HTGS is the Hybrid Task Graph Scheduler API that is designed to aid in creating task graphs for algoritms to obtain performance across CPUs and multiple-co-processors.

Ease of use

C++ Object-oriented design to quickly port existing computational functions into tasks to build complex task graphs.

Memory Management

Connect any task to memory(CPU or GPU) to keep your algorithms running within memory limits.

Extreme Pipelining

Every task is bound to one or more threads, such that each task will compute asynchronously with all other tasks in the graph.

Execution across ALL CPUs and GPUs

Decompose your problem domain and distribute data to execution pipelines, where each pipeline runs on a separate GPU taking advantage of distributed multi-GPU computation.

Customize

The API is templatized as easy-to-use interfaces to quickly create new tasks that can be shared and used for a wide variety of algorithms.

Lightweight and easy to Install

The entire API is a series of header files. Just include the header files in your project and begin creating task graphs. Includes CMake configuration to generated documentation and run unit tests.

Features

  • C++11
  • Pipelined Multi-Threaded
  • Coarse-Grained Parallelism
  • Multi-CPU and Multi-GPU
  • High Performance
  • Visual Debugging
  • Feature Rich API
  • Open Source

Get Started

Installation

  • Dependencies:
  • cmake v2.7+
  • g++/gcc v4.8.4+ (C++11)
  • pthreads
  • (Optional) doxygen
  • CMake Options:
  • CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX - Where to install HTGS (and documentation)
  • BUILD_DOXYGEN - Creates doxygen documentation (view online at: Documentation)
  • RUN_GTEST - Compiles and runs google unit tests for HTGS ('make run-test' to re-run)

 :$ git clone https://github.com/usnistgov/HTGS.git
 :$ cd <HTGS_Directory>
 :<HTGS_Directory>$ mkdir build && cd build
 :<HTGS_Directory>/build$ ccmake ../         (or cmake-gui)

 'Configure' and setup cmake parameters
 'Configure' and 'Build'

 :<HTGS_Directory>/build$ make
 :<HTGS_Directory>/build$ make install

Using HTGS

  • HTGS API:
  • htgs::IData
  • htgs::ITask
  • htgs::TaskGraph
  • htgs::Runtime

Brief example of adding two numbers using HTGS. (As seen in Tutorial 1):


  #include <htgs/api/IData.hpp>
  #include <htgs/api/ITask.hpp>
  #include <htgs/api/TaskGraph.hpp>
  #include <htgs/api/Runtime.hpp>

  class InputData : public htgs::IData
  {
    public:
      InputData(int x, int y) : x(x), y(y) {}
      int getX() const { return x; }
      int getY() const { return y; }
    private:
      int x, y;
  }

  class OutputData : public htgs::IData
  {
    public:
      OutputData(int result) : result(result) {}
      int getResult() const { return result; }
    private:
      int result;
  }

  class AddTask : public htgs::ITask<InputData, OutputData>
  {
    public:
      virtual void initialize(int pipelineId, int numPipeline) { }
      virtual void shutdown() { }
      virtual void isTerminated(std::shared_ptr<htgs::BaseConnector> inputConnector) {
        return inputConnector->isInputTerminated();
      }
      virtual AddTask *copy() { return new AddTask(); }
      virtual void executeTask(std::shared_ptr<InputData> data) {
        int sum = data->getX() + data->getY();
        this->addResult(new OutputData(sum));
      }
  }

  int main() {
    AddTask *addTask = new AddTask();
    auto taskGraph = new htgs::TaskGraph<InputData, OutputData>();
    taskGraph->addGraphOutputProducer(addTask);
    taskGraph->addGraphInputConsumer(addTask);
    taskGraph->incrmenetGraphInputProducers();

    auto runtime = new htgs::Runtime(taskGraph);
    runtime->executeRuntime();

    int numData = 10;
    for (int i = 0; i < numData; i++) {
      auto inputData = new InputData(i, i);
      taskGraph->produceData(inputData);
    }

    taskGraph->finishedProducingData();

    runtime->waitForRuntime();

    while(!taskGraph->isOutputTerminated()) {
      auto data = taskGraph->consumeData();
      std::cout << "Result: " << data->getResult();
    }

    delete runtime;
  }
  • Sample Output:
  • Result: 0
  • Result: 2
  • Result: 4
  • Result: 6
  • Result: 8
  • Result: 10
  • Result: 12
  • Result: 14
  • Result: 16
  • Result: 18

Full Documentation

For full explanation of Tutorial 1 and other tutorials showing how to use all of the components, please visit the doxygen documentation below.

  • HTGS API:
  • Bookkeeper | ExecutionPipeline | ICudaTask | ICustomEdge | IData | IMemoryAllocator
  • IMemoryReleaseRule | IRule | ITask | MemoryData | Runtime | TaskGraph | VoidData
